com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Interface Smarted<AggregateClass>

  • Type Parameters:
    AggregateClass - the aggregate class accessible though the setAggregate(Object) and getAggregate() methods
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Smartable<AggregateClass>, SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSmartListActivity, AbstractWrappedSmartListActivity, Droid4mizer, ForBusinessObjectActivity, SmartActionBarActivity, SmartActivity, SmartDialogFragment, SmartDialogFragment, SmartFragment, SmartFragment, SmartFragmentActivity, SmartGroupActivity, SmartListActivity, SmartListViewFragment, SmartListViewFragment, SmartMapActivity, SmartPreferenceActivity, SmartPreferenceFragment, SmartSplashScreenActivity, SmartTabActivity, WrappedSmartListActivity

    public interface Smarted<AggregateClass>
    Defines some common methods for all Activity and Fragment entities defined in the framework.
    Since:
    2010.07.10
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Gives access to an Android default SharedPreferences of the hosting Android application.

    • Method Detail

      • getAggregate

        AggregateClass getAggregate()
        Gives access to the entity underlying "aggregate" object.

        This "aggregate" is especially useful to provide data to the entity, and is typically used by the ActivityController.Interceptor through the entity life cycle events.

        Returns:
        an object that may be used along the Activity/Fragment entity life ; may return null
        See Also:
        setAggregate(Object)

      • setAggregate

        void setAggregate(AggregateClass aggregate)
        Enables to set an aggregate hat may be used along the Activity/Fragment entity life.
        Parameters:
        aggregate - the object to use as an aggregate ; may be null
        See Also:
        getAggregate()

      • registerBroadcastListeners

        void registerBroadcastListeners(AppPublics.BroadcastListener[] broadcastListeners)
        Explicitly registers some wrapped broadcast receivers for the Activity/Fragment entity. This method is especially useful to declare and consume at the same place broadcast intents.

        Those receivers will finally be unregistered by the Activity.onDestroy()/Fragment.onDestroy() method.

        When invoking that method, all previously registered listeners via the AppPublics.BroadcastListenerProvider or AppPublics.BroadcastListenersProvider are kept, and the new provided ones are added.

        Parameters:
        broadcastListeners - the wrapped receivers to registers
        See Also:
        AppPublics.BroadcastListener, AppPublics.BroadcastListenerProvider, AppPublics.BroadcastListenerProviders

      • onException

        void onException(java.lang.Throwable throwable,
               boolean fromGuiThread)
        This is a centralized method which will be invoked by the framework any time an exception is thrown by the entity.

        It may be also invoked from the implementing entity, when an exception is thrown, so that the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler handles it.

        Parameters:
        fromGuiThread - indicates whether the call is done from the GUI thread

      • getHandler

        android.os.Handler getHandler()
        Gives access to an Android Handler, which is useful when executing a routine which should be run from the UI thread.
        Returns:
        a valid handler that may be used by the entity for processing GUI-thread operations

      • getPreferences

        android.content.SharedPreferences getPreferences()
        Gives access to an Android default SharedPreferences of the hosting Android application.
        Returns:
        a valid default application preferences object
